On account of the perpetuity and diffusion of this system throughout the civilized world, it is not too much to say that its importance as a constituent factor of civil society is even greater in modern than it was in ancient times. What has con- tributed so largely to the growth of civilization ought certainly to be regarded as a worthy subject of historical study, and hence as forming an indispensable part of a liberal education.

In view of this historical significance of the Roman law, its study has already been introduced into a few colleges as acces- sory to the department of history.
